COURSES.name: Computing in the Business Environment
COURSES.description: Presents fundamental concepts from two perspectives: the individual business computer user and the corporate business computing environment. Introduces common business computing applications; this is not a  hands on  applications training course. Students use their existing computer skills to complete assignments.
COURSES.prerequisites: Credits: 4; Prereq: basic skills for Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, Excel and Internet.

sections.note:
COURSE NUMBER 17934 REQUIRES ONLINE PROCTORING FOR EXAMS. YOU WILL 
NEED A WEBCAM AND HIGH SPEED INTERNET ACCESS FOR THIS COURSE 
FOR LECTURE RECORDING TIME & LOCATION GO TO 
http://warrington.ufl.edu/undergraduate/myheavener/videolectures.

COURSES.name: Introduction to Information Systems
COURSES.description: Introduces the role of information systems and technology in an organization with a focus on the use of Access and Excel to solve business problems. Receive the knowledge necessary to earn Microsoft certifications in Access and Excel.
COURSES.prerequisites: Credits: 4; Prereq: MAC 2311 or MAC 2233, and sophomore standing.

sections.note:
THIS SECTION IS FOR STUDENTS WHO WILL NOT BE IN GAINESVILLE **
AND USES PROCTORU FOR EXAMS. YOU WILL NEED A WEBCAM AND HIGH SPEED **
INTERNET ACCESS. YOU MUST MEET WITH AN ADVISOR TO REGISTER. **
GO TO http://warrington.ufl.edu/academics/distance.asp **

COURSES.name: Business Systems 1
COURSES.description: Introduces the basic tools for building business systems using object-oriented and event-driven programming paradigms. Emphasizes using Java to illustrate these ideas.

sections.note: CLASS NUMBER 17933 IS A TWO-CREDIT COURSE THAT MEETS THE FIRST HALF OF THE SEMESTER (AUGUST 22st - OCTOBER 14th)

COURSES.name: Business Systems 2
COURSES.description: Continuation of the course sequence to develop the basic tools for building business systems using object-oriented and event-driven programming paradigms. Emphasizes using C# to illustrate these ideas.

sections.note: CLASS NUMBER 17850 IS A TWO-CREDIT COURSE THAT MEETS THE SECOND HALF OF THE SEMESTER (OCTOBER 22nd - DECEMBER 14th).

COURSES.name: Business Systems Design and Applications
COURSES.description: Conceptual foundations of the process, data and object oriented approaches for the analysis and design of business systems. Systems development life cycle, rapid application design, CASE tools also covered.

sections.note: CLASS NUMBER 17879 IS A TWO-CREDIT COURSE THAT MEETS THE FIRST HALF OF THE SEMESTER (AUGUST 22st - OCTOBER 14th)

COURSES.name: Database Management
COURSES.description: Introductory database management. Topics include various stages in a database development process such as conceptual, logical, application and physical design.

sections.note: CLASS NUMBER 17942 IS A TWO-CREDIT COURSE THAT MEETS THE SECOND HALF OF THE SEMESTER (OCTOBER 22nd - DECEMBER 14th).

COURSES.name: Business Data Communications 1
COURSES.description: Various aspects of telecommunication systems, the use of local and wide area networks, the Internet, wireless technologies and distributed systems for decision making and strategic management questions relating to business goals, long-range planning and budgeting.

sections.note: CLASS NUMBER 17851 IS A TWO-CREDIT COURSE THAT MEETS THE FIRST HALF OF THE SEMESTER (AUGUST 22st - OCTOBER 14th)

COURSES.name: Information Systems and Operations Strategy
COURSES.description: Policy and management issues surrounding information systems and operations management in today's enterprises.
COURSES.prerequisites: Credits: 2: Prereq: ISM 4113, ISM 4210 and ISM 4220.

sections.note: CLASS NUMBER 17758 IS A TWO-CREDIT COURSE THAT MEETS THE SECOND HALF OF THE SEMESTER (OCTOBER 22nd - DECEMBER 14th).

COURSES.name: Operations and Supply Chain Management
COURSES.description: Managerial concepts and quantitative tools required in the design, operation, and control of production systems and their relationship to business functions.
COURSES.prerequisites: Credits: 4; Prereq: BUL 4310, FIN 3403, GEB 3373, MAC 2233, MAN 3025, MAR 3023, QMB 3250 and STA 2023. BA and AC majors only.

sections.note:
COURSE NUMBER 17132 REQUIRES ONLINE PROCTORING FOR EXAMS. YOU WILL

FOR LECTURE RECORDING TIME & LOCATION GO TO

COURSES.name: Integrated Product and Process Design 1
COURSES.description: The first part of a two-course sequence in which multidisciplinary teams of engineering and business students partner with industry sponsors to design and build authentic products and processes-on time and within budget. Working closely with industry liaison engineers and a faculty coach, students gain practical experience in teamwork and communication, problem solving and engineering design, and develop leadership, management and people skills.

COURSES.name: Statistics for Business Decisions
COURSES.description: Correlation and linear regression, model building, multiple regression, analysis of variance, time series analysis and decision analysis. Regression modeling with computer applications for business problems.
COURSES.prerequisites: Prereq: STA 2023. Open only to students who need this course for their major or who have permission from the WCBA.

sections.note:
